titlepage.subtitle:

The University of Virginia Library 11192-e
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Southern Student Organizing Committee Additional Papers
1963-1979
did.physdesc: This collection contains ca. 500 items (4 Hollinger boxes and 3 oversize boxes, ca. 1.5 linear feet).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
Univeristy of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Southern Student Organizing Committee Additional Papers, 1963-1979, Accession #11192-e, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These papers were given to the University of Virginia Library on October 2, 1996, by Steve Wise of Atlanta, Georgia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of additional papers of the Southern Student Organizing Committee, ca. 1963-1979, and undated, collected by Steve Wise, including miscellaneous publications; some by a variety of other organizations. Materials include printed items, memoranda, mimeographed publications, newspapers, articles, typed manuscripts, news clippings, order blanks for literature, agendas, conference materials, and form letters concerning student events.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The publications have been arranged alphabetically according to the name of the organization responsible for the material or its subject. A full listing of each subject or publication can be found in the box listing under its folder heading.

did.unittitle:
A-B (general)
1963-1968

scopecontent.p: including: The Activist (1966); AFL-CIO American Federationist reprints re corporate profits and organizing; the Agrarian Work Project; U.S. Dept. of Agriculture economic reports No. 26 & 28; The American Student (1966); A Just Family Income Policy by Americans for Democratic Action; articles about Appalachia and its problems; articles about "Black Power"; Bolivia: Another Vietnam?; The Nomination of Farris Bryant: Some Facts and Analysis

did.unittitle:
C (general)
1965-1977

scopecontent.p: including: Campus Progressive (1966 April 22); human rights in Chile (1977); Toward the New City; College Young Democratic Clubs of America by-laws, platform, and manual; Committee For World Development and World Disarmament The Case for Development; Community Foundation Memorandum #1; Connections Supplement ; article on Consumer Co-ops written for Radicals in the Professions" by Richard Rothstein; Conversion Report (1964); articles on cybernation by Dale Richard Caldwell and Robert Theobald

did.unittitle: Conference on Radical Vocations in the White Community [1968?] February

D-J (general)
1964-1967

scopecontent.p: including: Democratic ACTION (1966 September); form letter inviting people to attend a conference for friends of the "democratic left"; "How to Expose & Fight the Democratic Party in Your Community by Lee Webb; Dimensions Discussion Journal of the W.E.B. Dubois Clubs (1966); DOW All Over by Bob Schwartz; Duke Employees Local 77; 49th Ward Committee for Independent Political Action (1966); "The Genesis of the Great Society" by William E. Leuchtenberg; GROW A New Movement in the White South by Robert Analavage; paper on "Free Public Higher Education"; The Iconoclast Our Purpose by Robert Dewart; Building Lyndon Johnson by David Welsh; J.O.I.N. (Jobs or Income Now) newsletters and article, "Interracial Economic Organizing in Philadelphia"

unittitle.title: Fellowship. The Magazine of the Fellowship of Reconciliation

did.unittitle: The Institute for Policy Studies Problems and Prospects of the New South: A Seminar Series for Congressional Assistants1966 April-June
K-L (general) 1965-1979, n.d.

scopecontent.p: including: economic development in Kentucky; The case of the Knoxville College Students; Civil Disorders in Louisville, Kentucky; League For Industrial Democracy news bulletin (1966) and articles, "The Roots of the Dominican Crisis" by Theodore Draper (1965) and On the Nature of Communism and Relations with Communists;Libertarian (1968 May); LUCHA Christian Response to Military Repression in Latin America (1978-1979)

did.unittitle:
Letter from China by Anna Louise Strong
1966-1967

Lists of Literature Available from various organizations
1967-1968
Mississippi Material 1963-1966, n.d.
N-P (general) 1964-1967, n.d.
National Student Association Conference -- The Administration of Southern Justice, Oberlin College 1966 April 28-30
"A New Left Manifesto" by Paul Booth and Edward Greer 1968 January 28

News Notes of the Central Committee for Conscientious Objectors
1966-1967
New clippings, chiefly about the SDS 1967, 1969
R-Z (general) 1964-1969, n.d.

scopecontent.p: including: The Rap ; "Some Facts about Repression"; articles about schools, "Electronics & the Psychic Drop-Out" by Marshall McLuhan and "Schools and Segregation"; Socialist Party; the South in "From the First Reconstruction to the Second" by C. Vann Woodward; South Africa; the Southern Conference Educational Fund; "The Southern Mystique" by Howard Zinn; SSRP Newsletter (Southern Rural Research Project); Southern States Industrial Council "The Unionization of the South"; articles about students; "Urban Policy in the Rationalized Society" by Donald N. Michael; articles and material about the Vietnam War; Virginia Students' Civil Rights Committee; Watts Hospital Chapter of Local 77; Young Socialist article: The Attempt to Restore Stalin

did.unittitle:
Radical Education Project
1966-1967

scopecontent.p: including: "Contemptuous Hairdressers - Ceremonies of Humiliation in School" by Edgar Z. Friedenberg; "Medical Ghettos" by Anselm L. Strauss; "The U.A.W. settles with Ford - Sellout and Insurgency in the Auto Industry" by Jim Jacobs; "Corporate Imperialism for the Poor" by Richard Cloward and Frances Fox Piven; "The Great Flint Sit-Down Strike Against G.M. 1936-1937" by Walter Linder; "Socialist Man and the Chinese Revolution The Basis of the Cultural Revolution" by Donald McKelvey; "Wildcat: Anatomy of a Work Stoppage" by Steve Fox; "Power in American Society" by Jim Jacobs; "A Seminar On Radicalism in American History" by Ken Walzer and Dennis Gregg; "Black Liberation" by Earl Ofari; "The Contradiction of Advanced Capitalist Society and its Resolution" by Martin Nicolaus; "In a Crisis The Center Falls Out: The Role of the Faculty in The Columbia Strike" by Dick Greeman; and "Democracy and the University" by Richard K. Pope

did.unittitle: Southern Regional Council Special Reports 1965-1966, n.d.
Southern Student Organizing Committee 1965-1968, n.d.
Southern Student Organizing Committee -- Articles ca. 1965-1968

scopecontent.p: concerning: civil rights, racism, the Vietnam War, high school reform, the decay of cities, educational issues, student power movements, radicalism, Latin America, student social action, DOW Chemical Corporation, the new left, the draft, the Selective Service System, American imperialism, Nashville power structure, nonviolence, the Democratic Party, labor in the South, women's liberation, "poor whites," and revolution

did.unittitle: Students for a Democratic Society 1964-1969, n.d.
Students for a Democratic Society -- Articles ca. 196301968

scopecontent.p: concerning: the Columbia University rebellion, introduction to the SDS, perspective of U.S. history, Cuba, imperialism, Huey Newton, cultural revolution in China, U.S. foreign relations, high school reform, students and labor, leadership, the War on Poverty, Dixiecrats, Appalachia, the Vietnam War, bibliographies, community organizing, poverty, eastern Kentucky, working class, the Brazil coup, civil rights, the South, Barry Goldwater, strikes, economic development, and the freedom movement in Massachusetts

did.unittitle:
Student Union for Peace Action (SUPA) Articles
1962-1966

scopecontent.p: including an organizing manual, U.S. colonialism in Canada, power structures, education & political values, social change and the international system, developing countries, U.S. relations with China, and ideology and revolution

did.unittitle: "Towards a Theory of Social Change in America" by David Gilbert, Robert Gottlieb, and Gerry Tenney 1967 January 23
University Christian Movement The Second Look1967
Virginia Students' Civil Rights Committee 1966, n.d.
NEWSPAPERS

SDS New Left Notes/SDS FIRE!
1966-1969
